climbs.name: Shady Gem
climbs.fa: TIm Loften, Paul Muehl, & Rick Cordes May 29,1982

content.description: Starting just to the left of Janine's Arete and about 10 feet to the right of the wide crack. Climb up the face and gain two horns that can be slung. After the second is where the first bolt is. Continue up the amazing featured face clipping the second bolt and exiting out left. A little spicy but really good stone.

climbs.name: Janine's Arete
climbs.fa: Tim and Janine McCabe and Mark DeVries

content.description: A nice little arete climb that should not be missed if in this area. Start off by crystal pinching up the well protected arete, clipping 4 bolts. Then exit out right to the thin hands crack for the finish.
content.protection: 4 bolts, small to medium cams   Webbing Anchor
content.location: On the uphill east side the right hand arete.

content.description: If in the area and are looking for fun moderates, this is a great little formation. Holds two 5.9s that are well worth doing.
